lead_paragraph: Breeders’ Cup entrants will be tested randomly for blood-doping agents 10 days before the races, the California Horse Racing Board said. Officials are looking for epoetin, darbepoetin and other blood-doping agents that are administered days or weeks before the competition, the board said. The drugs are usually not detected in samples collected after races. The Breeders’ Cup series will be run Oct. 24 and 25 at Santa Anita Park in Arcadia, Calif.
